intro: Erythranthe dentata, commonly known as the toothed rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are finely toothed, giving it the species name "dentata," and its flowers are usually pale yellow or white. Erythranthe dentata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
